channel.title: math.CV updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.CV updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Deformation Families of Quasi-Projective Varieties and Symmetric Projective K3 Surfaces
item.description: arXiv:2406.16208v2 Announce Type: new Abstract: The main aim of this paper is to construct a deformation family of symmetric projective K3 surfaces through a deformation family of quasi-projective varieties together with construction of symmetric Kahler metrics on symmetric projective K3 surfaces. Firstly, if the normal bundle satisfies the Diophantine condition, the tubular neighborhood of an elliptic curve embedded in $\text{CP}^2 \text{$\#$9} \overline{\text{CP}}^2$ can be identified through the toroidal group. Secondly, with ample line bundles fixed on $\text{CP}^2 \text{$\#$9} \overline{\text{CP}}^2$, complete Kahler metrics are constructed on the quasi-projective variety from $\text{CP}^2 \text{$\#$9} \overline{\text{CP}}^2$. Finally, a deformation family of symmetric projective K3 surfaces over a 10-dimensional complex manifold is constructed through a smooth compactifiable deformation of complete quasi-projective varieties from $\text{CP}^2 \text{$\#$9} \overline{\text{CP}}^2$ over a 9-dimensional complex manifold and an analogue deformation family.
item.dc:creator: Fan Xu

item.title: On CR maps from the sphere into the tube over the future light cone II: Higher dimensions
item.description: arXiv:2406.16428v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We determine all CR maps from the sphere in $\mathbb{C}^3$ into the tube over the future light cone in $\mathbb{C}^4$. This result leads to a complete characterization of proper holomorphic maps from the three-dimensional unit ball into the classical domain of type IV of four dimension and confirms a conjecture of Reiter - Son in [26] from 2022. Additionally, we prove a boundary characterization of isometric holomorphic embeddings from a ball into a classical domain of type IV in arbitrary dimensions that is similar to the main result in Huang - Lu - Tang - Xiao [16]. The result is then used to treat a special case in the general characterization.
item.dc:creator: Michael Reiter, Duong Ngoc Son

item.title: Non-Archimedean techniques and dynamical degenerations
item.description: arXiv:2406.15892v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We develop non-Archimedean techniques to analyze the degeneration of a sequence of rational maps of the complex projective line. We provide an alternative to Luo's method which was based on ultra-limits of the hyperbolic 3-space. We build hybrid spaces using Berkovich theory which enable us to prove the convergence of equilibrium measures, and to determine the asymptotics of Lyapunov exponents.
item.dc:creator: Charles Favre, Chen Gong

item.title: Relationships Between the Bergman Kernels of Hartogs Domains and Their Base
item.description: arXiv:2208.14291v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We explore the relationship between the Bergman kernel of a Hartogs domain and weighted Bergman kernels over its base domain. In particular we develop a representation of the Bergman kernel of a Hartogs domain as a series involving weighted Bergman kernels over its base, as well as a "transformation" formula for some weighted Bergman kernels. Other relationships of this type are presented.
item.dc:creator: Blake J. Boudreaux

item.title: Characterizations of Griffiths Positivity, Pluriharmonicity and Flatness
item.description: arXiv:2210.17361v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Deng-Ning-Wang-Zhou showed that a Hermitian holomorphic vector bundle is Griffiths semi-positive if it satisfies the optimal $L^2$-extension condition. As a generalization, we present a quantitative characterization of Griffiths positivity in terms of certain $L^2$-extension conditions. We also show that a $\mathbb{R}$-valued measurable function is pluriharmonic if and only if it satisfies the equality part of the optimal $L^p$-extension condition. This answers a conjecture of Inayama affirmatively. Moreover, the flatness of a possibly singular Hermitian metric is also equivalent to the equality part of the optimal $L^p$-extension condition.
item.dc:creator: Zhuo Liu, Wang Xu

item.title: Continuity of functions in complex Sobolev spaces
item.description: arXiv:2312.01635v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We study the continuity regularity of functions in the complex Sobolev spaces. As applications, we obtain Hermitian generalizations of a recent result due Guedj-Guenancia-Zeriahi on the diameters of Kaehler metrics.
item.dc:creator: Duc-Viet Vu

item.title: On Picard's Theorem Via Nevanlinna Theory
item.description: arXiv:2405.09659v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We study a long-standing Picard's problem for non-compact complete K\"ahler manifolds with non-negative Ricci curvature. When the manifold carries a positive Green function, a positive answer is given to the Picard's problem, i.e., it is showed that every meromorphic function on such a manifold reduces to a constant if it omits three distinct values.
item.dc:creator: Xianjing Dong

item.title: Asymptotics of Polynomials Orthogonal With Respect to a Generalized Freud Weight With Application to Special Function Solutions of Painlev\'e-IV
item.description: arXiv:2312.11294v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We obtain asymptotics of polynomials satisfying the orthogonality relations $$ \int_{\mathbb{R}} z^k P_n(z; t , N) \mathrm{e}^{-N \left(\frac{1}{4}z^4 + \frac{t}{2}z^2 \right)} \mathrm{d} z = 0 \quad \text{ for } \quad k = 0, 1, ..., n-1, $$ where the complex parameter $t$ is in the so-called two-cut region. As an application, we deduce asymptotic formulas for certain families of solutions of Painlev\'e-IV which are indexed by a non-negative integer and can be written in terms of parabolic cylinder functions. The proofs are based on the characterization of orthogonal polynomials in terms of a Riemann-Hilbert problem and the Deift-Zhou non-linear steepest descent method.
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Barhoumi
